definition: to reoccur
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to reappear
to repeat a crime/persistent offender
to recur (of events, esp. adverse ones)/to repeat (a performance)
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
tragedy/calamity/atrocity
to draw a lesson (from a setback)
excessively tolerant/to overindulge (sb)/overly conciliatory/to seek appeasement at any price
to repeat/to follow the same road as
hard to say/can't guarantee/difficult to protect/difficult to preserve
to sit and watch, but remain indifferent (idiom)
to permit/to allow
irreversible
to put an end to
to put up with/to tolerate
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
tragedy/CL:齣|出[chu1]
